results.title: The Industrial city
results.creator_credit: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses a case study of the industrial city of Detroit in order to present a view of the function of the industrial community in modern American society. Emphasises the fact that the future of a city depends on the education, training and ability of the people. Also discusses the automobile industry where 10,000 cars are produced per day at this time. Touches on the problems of traffic congestion, pollution, poverty and clime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Immortal story
results.creator_credit: Orson Welles, Micheline Rozan, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais and Albina Productions
results.brief_description: Orson Welles stars and directs (as he so often does, and does well) in this adaptation of Isak Dinesen’s (Karen Blixen) story. The story is from a novella and concerns a wealthy Macao merchant, Mr Clay (Welles) who attempts to prove his power by making an old seaman’s legend into fact. Welles cleverly uses the original story as a basis of a philosophical inquisition. Cast includes Orson Welles, Jeanne Moreau, Roger Coggio and Norman Eshley. Music by Eric Satie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Orson Welles, Micheline Rozan, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais and Albina Productions

results.title: The Horn. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Ifor James explains the complexities of the modern double horn and its use in the modern symphony orchestra. The part played by the horn in chamber music is also illustrated and tribute paid to Dennis Brain, who is heard playing an excerpt from the Beethoven Horn Sonata.

results.title: The Horn. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Ifor James demonstrates the evolution of the horn from the old hunting horn of nearly 300 years ago, through each stage of its development to the orchestral horn and the modern valve horn, which is capable of rapid changes in key called for by contemporary composers. Illustrated with excerpts from Handel, Mozart and Weber.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Harp
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Osian Ellis describes the development of the harp from Biblical times. The complexities of the pedals and their uses, together with various methods of playing are demonstrated. Includes Gavette en Ronda by Bach.

results.title: The Indian in the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Jane Startz, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Scholastic Productions and Kennedy/Marshall Company
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Lynne Reid Banks, ‘The Indian in the cupboard’ is a heartwarming adventure about nine year old Omri who magically brings his three-inch toy Indian Little Bear to life. Some of the scenes may not be suitable for very young children however the amazing adventures of these two friends is sure to delight.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Oz, Jane Startz, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Scholastic Productions and Kennedy/Marshall Company

results.title: The Immortal battalion = The Way ahead
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Sutro, Norman Walker, Two Cities Films and G C F
results.brief_description: Beginning as a British Army training film called “The New lot”, this film was then expanded into a feature length film written by Eric Ambler and Peter Ustinov, entitled “The Way ahead” for its British audience and re-edited into a slightly shorter film entitled “The Immortal battalion” for an American audience. Its basic concept is as a recruiting and training film for the British Army mixing training and combat footage with filmed sequences. The storyline is about a bunch of raw recruits from a variety of backgrounds who are finally welded into a unified and disciplined regimental unit ready for battle. Stars David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Peter Ustinov, Trevor Howard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carol Reed, John Sutro, Norman Walker, Two Cities Films and G C F

Its basic concept is as a recruiting and training film for the British Army mixing training and combat footage with filmed sequences. The storyline is about a bunch of raw recruits from a variety of backgrounds who are finally welded into a unified and disciplined regimental unit ready for battle. Stars David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Peter Ustinov, Trevor Howard.

results.title: The Guitar
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
This film briefly outlines the history of the guitar through a period of six thousand years. Guitarist John Williams examines the construction of the instrument; describes the nature and tuning of the strings, placing of the frets, and demonstrates all the varieties of sound possible using music by Bach, Paganini, Weber and Schubert. Includes sequences on the lute, electric guitar and Spanish classical guitar.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and Anvil Film and Recording Group

Includes sequences on the lute, electric guitar and Spanish classical guitar.
